definition: to extend New Year's greetings/to pay a New Year's visit
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

sentences.english: On the new year's films, which film is the most harmonious one?
sentences.chinese: 透視今年賀歲檔，哪部影片最“和諧”？

sentences.english: Personally, I like Chinese New Year's movies very much.
sentences.chinese: 就個人而言，我非常喜歡中國賀歲片。

sentences.english: He is not a born director of the new-year-movie, it is the market that makes that.
sentences.chinese: 他並非天生的賀歲片導演而是市場使然。

sentences.english: Lunar New Year stalls in the domestic schedule in several schedule really is gold.
sentences.chinese: 賀歲檔在國內幾大檔期中確實屬於黃金檔期。

sentences.english: In chapter I , I analyze the market-based tactic adopted in Feng Xiaogang's movie for greeting the New Year emphatically.
sentences.chinese: 上篇着重分析了馮小剛賀歲影片所採取的市場化策略。

sentences.english: Part there: Basic forms of New Year Movie.
And he has also worked on many chinese new year films, which all had good acting skills.
sentences.chinese: 他還演過很多賀歲片，都演得非常棒。

sentences.english: Feng's New Year celebration films have become a brand name in the past years.
sentences.chinese: 馮小剛的賀歲影片近年來已經成爲一個品牌。

sentences.english: The New Year blockbuster "Desire of the heart" is very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 賀歲影片《桃花運》非常有趣。

sentences.english: Undoubtedly, Feng Xiaogang's movie for greeting the New Year caters some laws of the film market.
sentences.chinese: 馮小剛的賀歲片創作無疑符合了電影市場的某些規律。

sentences.english: Which one is the most harmonious according to this new year's films?
sentences.chinese: 透視今年賀歲檔，哪部影片最“和諧”？

sentences.english: Lion Dance, Cultural Performance, Acrobatic Performance and Lucky Draw.
sentences.chinese: 醒獅賀歲，精彩表演，新春抽獎，與衆同樂。

definition: large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
to beat the gong to open a performance
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
